column5: Any one know where I can get one?  Thanks
Sail is a dealer and if you find one on the floor, dint be afraid to haggle! Point out some scratches and marks etc. I got taxes thrown in when i bought mt Tarpon 100 there

Thanks so much for your information and reply. I went to Vaughan Sail few days ago and looked around but no Native foot peddle kayak there then I asked the associate and she said they don't carry the Foot Peddle Kayak because it is too expensive to stock in. Can you tell me which Sail Store has it?  Thanks again!

Thanks so much for your information and reply. I went to Vaughan Sail few days ago and looked around but no Native foot peddle kayak there then I asked the associate and she said they don't carry the Foot Peddle Kayak because it is too expensive to stock in. Can you tell me which Sail Store has it?  Thanks again!   You can go on there website and check inventory by each location
Actually I did web through their site but they don't have foot peddle kayak at all

Last year I thought they had a couple on display in vaughn. Different model I think, but a couple propels... Have you tried one? Because the best advice on any yak is try before you buy! I loved most aspects of mine but felt very cramped in it. Sold it when i bought my motor boat, but had a canoe before the yak and liked the extra bit of space for landing fish etc. I want a solo canoe/ hybrid now for getting out on a small lake near my house....
The Vaughan store did have them before the winter, they were around 2500.00, not sure why she couldn't find it. Think it might have been a Old Town model though......could be wrong on the make!
